writing_prompt: Every morning, Will Solace wakes up next to Nico di Angelo, the love of his life, and every morning begins with laughter, kisses, and the occasional battle to get out of bed—until one day, Nico suggests something that changes their routine forever.
story:
I woke up to the sound of Nico's snores, a gentle hum that I'd grown to love over the years. I smiled, feeling his warm body beside me, and leaned over to kiss his forehead. His eyes fluttered open, and he gazed at me with a sleepy grin.

"Morning, sunshine," he mumbled, his voice husky from sleep.

"Morning, grump," I replied, snuggling closer.

Our morning routine was a well-oiled machine. We'd wake up, exchange sweet nothings, and then engage in an epic battle to get out of bed. Nico was a master of procrastination, and I was the willing enabler. Today was no exception.

As we wrestled under the covers, pillows flew, and our laughter filled the room. The morning light filtering through the curtains cast a warm glow over our cozy bedroom, making everything feel like a dream.

After a few minutes of playful fighting, Nico dramatically flung himself back onto the bed, arms splayed wide. "I'm not getting up! I'm a demigod, hear me roar!"

I chuckled, crawling on top of him. "You're a demigod, all right. A demigod of sleep."

Nico's eyes sparkled with mischief. "Hey, someone has to keep the sleep gods happy."

I kissed him, and we dissolved into a fit of giggles. Our morning banter was the highlight of my day.

As we finally managed to drag ourselves out of bed, Nico suggested we make breakfast together. I agreed, and we stumbled into the kitchen, still grinning at each other.

As we cooked, our conversation turned from silly jokes to more serious topics. Nico mentioned his latest project, a magical ritual to help the camp's defenses. I listened intently, proud of his dedication to protecting our home.

As we sat down to eat, Nico's expression turned thoughtful. "Will, can I ask you something?"

"Anything, love," I replied, taking a bite of my toast.

Nico's eyes sparkled with a mischievous glint. "What if we started a new morning ritual? Something special, just for us?"

My curiosity piqued, I leaned in. "What did you have in mind?"

Nico's grin grew wider. "I was thinking we could have a magical breakfast. You know, summon some ambrosia, maybe invite a few mythical creatures to join us..."

I raised an eyebrow, intrigued. "You want to invite mythical creatures to breakfast?"

Nico nodded enthusiastically. "Why not? We're demigods, after all. We can make it happen."

I laughed, feeling a thrill of excitement. "You're crazy, Nico di Angelo. And I love it."

Nico's face lit up. "Really? You'll do it?"

I nodded, and we shared a kiss, the promise of a new adventure hanging in the air.

As we finished our breakfast, I realized that Nico's suggestion had changed our routine forever. We'd always had laughter, kisses, and battles to get out of bed, but now we had something more – a magical, whimsical twist that would bring us even closer together.

And as we walked hand in hand out of the kitchen, I knew that every morning with Nico would be a new opportunity for laughter, love, and a little bit of magic.

writing_prompt: Your partner insists you can look through their phone anytime, but when you do, you discover a collection of candid photos of yourself—each one capturing a moment you didn’t even realize was special.
story:
I flopped onto the couch, phone in hand, and settled in for a Netflix marathon. Will, my partner, was busy in the kitchen, whipping up dinner. I was supposed to be helping, but I'd gotten distracted by a particularly interesting cat video. As I waited for the next episode to load, I mindlessly started scrolling through Will's phone. He'd always been adamant that I could look through it anytime, but I rarely did. What could he possibly have on there that I didn't already know about?

As I scrolled through his photos, I stumbled upon a folder labeled "Nico's Awkward Moments." I raised an eyebrow, curiosity piqued. Inside, I found a collection of candid photos of me. Not just any photos, but moments I hadn't even realized were special. There was one of me sleeping on the couch, mouth agape, with a drool stain on my cheek. I chuckled, remembering that night. We'd had a late movie night, and I'd dozed off mid-film.

The next photo showed me attempting to cook breakfast, with a spatula in one hand and a frying pan in the other, looking like a complete disaster waiting to happen. Will had captioned it "The Great Pancake Debacle." I laughed, recalling the morning our kitchen had been covered in a fine layer of flour.

As I continued scrolling, the photos became more poignant. There was one of me staring out the window, lost in thought, with a look of quiet contemplation on my face. Another showed me reading a book, with a look of pure joy, and a faint smile on my lips. These moments, I realized, were the ones I didn't even know were special. The everyday moments that made up the fabric of our life together.

I felt a lump form in my throat as I kept scrolling. Each photo was a reminder of the little things Will noticed about me, the things that made him love me. I looked up to find Will standing in the doorway, a warm smile on his face, and a spatula in hand.

"Find something interesting?" he asked, his eyes twinkling.

I nodded, feeling a little emotional. "You've been taking these for a while, haven't you?"

Will nodded, coming over to sit beside me. "I like capturing the real you, not just the pose-y, perfect moments. You're beautiful, Nico, even when you're being awkward or lost in thought."

I turned to him, feeling my heart swell. "You're a bit of a creep, you know that?"

Will grinned. "Hey, someone's got to document your greatness. Besides, I figured if I ever lost you, I'd want to remember these moments."

I leaned in, my voice barely above a whisper. "You're not going to lose me, Will. I'm stuck to you like glue."

Will's smile softened, and he wrapped his arms around me. "I like being stuck with you, Nico."

As we hugged, I realized that these candid photos weren't just a collection of random moments; they were a testament to our love, a reminder that even in the mundane, there's beauty to be found.

writing_prompt: A mischievous makeup artist convinces their reluctant partner to star in a video, only to reveal a hilariously unexpected transformation—what happens next?
story:
I groaned, flopping down onto the couch beside Will, who was busy rummaging through his makeup bag. "No, no, no, I'm not doing it," I said, crossing my arms over my chest.

Will's eyes sparkled with mischief. "Come on, Nico! It'll be fun, I promise. You'll be a natural in front of the camera."

I raised an eyebrow. "I highly doubt that. And what's with the getup, anyway? You're not exactly known for your subtlety."

Will held up a bright pink wig and a tube of glitter eyeshadow. "Hey, this is for a special project. I'm going for a... unique look."

I sighed, but Will's enthusiasm was infectious. "Fine, but if I end up looking like a total idiot, I'm blaming you."

Will whooped in triumph, tossing the wig onto my head. "Don't worry, I'll make you look fabulous. Now, let's get started!"

As Will worked his magic, I couldn't help but laugh at his antics. He narrated the entire process with exaggerated flair, declaring, "And now, I shall apply the mystical foundation of the gods!" as he swept a brush across my face.

The result was... unexpected. I stared in the mirror, my jaw dropping as I took in the sight of myself transformed into a glittering, pink-haired merman. Will grinned, proud of his handiwork.

"You look amazing, Nico! The camera is going to love you."

I blinked, trying to process the... scales? Will had somehow managed to create shimmering scales on my arms and legs. "Uh, Will? What exactly is this look supposed to be?"

Will winked. "You, my dear, are a majestic merman, risen from the depths of the ocean to slay the world of social media."

I face-palmed. "You're ridiculous."

But as we started filming, I couldn't help but get into the spirit of things. Will's energy was infectious, and before long, I was laughing and joking with him like we were performing a comedy routine.

As we wrapped up the video, Will turned to me with a mischievous grin. "You know, I think this might just be my masterpiece."

I rolled my eyes good-naturedly. "You're a genius, Will. Or completely insane. Possibly both."

Will chuckled, pulling me into a hug. "That's why you love me, Nico."

I smiled, feeling a warmth spread through my chest. "Yeah, that's definitely part of it."

As we uploaded the video, I couldn't help but wonder what other unexpected adventures Will had in store for me. But with him by my side, I was ready to face whatever came next – glitter and all.

writing_prompt: While navigating the Labyrinth, Nico encounters a strange, freckled boy claiming to be from the future—and his future boyfriend.
story:
The air was stale and musty, the cold stone walls echoing with whispers of the past. Nico muttered to himself as he navigated the twisting paths of the Labyrinth, his eyes scanning the map etched on the parchment in his hand. He'd been warned not to come here alone, but he had to find a way to get to the heart of the maze. The Oracle's words still lingered in his mind, a constant reminder of his quest.

As he turned a corner, a figure emerged from the shadows. Nico's hand instinctively went to the dagger at his waist, but the boy's bright smile and messy mop of curly brown hair put him at ease. Well, almost.

"Hey, you're Nico di Angelo, right?" the boy asked, his eyes sparkling with an otherworldly intensity. Nico raised an eyebrow, intrigued despite himself.

"How do you know my name?" he asked, trying to keep his tone neutral.

"Oh, I know a lot of things," the boy said with a grin, producing a small, sleek device from his pocket. "I'm from the future."

Nico snorted, rolling his eyes. "Sure you are, buddy. And I'm the King of Sparta."

The boy chuckled, unfazed. "I get that a lot. But trust me, I'm telling the truth. My name is Will, by the way. And in the future... we're boyfriends."

Nico's eyes widened, his mind stuttering. "What?"

Will nodded, his expression deadpan. "Yeah, I know, it's a lot to take in. But I've come to warn you, Nico. You're in danger. The Labyrinth is shifting, and you need to get out of here, now."

Nico's skepticism warred with a growing sense of unease. There was something about Will's words that resonated deep within him, a spark of truth that he couldn't quite ignore.

"What do you mean, we're boyfriends?" Nico asked, trying to sound nonchalant despite the butterflies in his stomach.

Will's grin returned, and he took a step closer to Nico. "Well, let's just say we have a... complicated history. But in the future, we're happy. Really happy."

Nico's eyes met Will's, and for a moment, they just stared at each other. The air seemed to thicken, the whispers in the walls growing louder.

"I don't know what to say," Nico admitted, feeling a little lost.

Will's expression softened. "You don't have to say anything, Nico. Just listen. I know this is a lot to take in, but I'm here to help you. And... I want to be with you, even if it's just for a little while."

The words sent a shiver down Nico's spine. He'd never been one for grand romantic gestures, but there was something about Will's sincerity that drew him in.

"Okay," Nico said finally, his voice barely above a whisper. "I'll listen."

Will's face lit up, and he reached out, brushing a strand of hair behind Nico's ear. The touch sent sparks flying through Nico's veins, and for the first time in a long time, he felt a sense of hope.

As they navigated the twisting paths of the Labyrinth together, Nico couldn't shake the feeling that his destiny was shifting, that the threads of fate were weaving together in ways he couldn't yet understand. But with Will by his side, he felt a sense of courage he hadn't felt in years.

Maybe, just maybe, this strange, freckled boy from the future was telling the truth. And maybe, just maybe, Nico was ready to take a chance on a future he'd never imagined.

writing_prompt: After surviving the horrors of Tartarus, Will and Nico have developed quiet rituals to soothe their lingering fears. One sleepless night, they find themselves dancing in the kitchen, holding each other close as the weight of their shared past fades into the rhythm of the present.
story:
The kitchen clock ticked away, its rhythmic pulse the only sound breaking the silence of the night. Will and Nico sat on the counter, their feet dangling in the air, eyes fixed on the darkened window. The storm outside seemed to mirror the turmoil within, the shadows cast by the kitchen light eerily reminiscent of the underworld's darkness.

Will's eyes drifted to Nico, his gaze tracing the sharp lines of his face, the way his eyes seemed to hold a perpetual sadness. He knew that look, had seen it in the mirror often enough. The weight of their past still lingered, a constant presence that threatened to consume them.

Nico caught his gaze, a small smile playing on his lips. "Hey," he whispered, his voice barely audible over the clock's steady beat.

Will's response was a gentle nod, his eyes never leaving Nico's face. The silence between them was comfortable, a testament to the countless nights they'd spent lost in their own thoughts.

Suddenly, Nico's hand slipped into his, their fingers intertwining like the threads of a familiar tapestry. "Want to dance?" he asked, his voice low and husky.

Will's eyebrows arched in surprise, but he nodded, a small smile creeping onto his face. The kitchen wasn't exactly a dance floor, but Nico's eyes sparkled with mischief, and Will couldn't resist.

They slid off the counter, their bare feet padding softly on the tile floor. The radio in the corner, previously silent, sprang to life, the melodic strains of a soft ballad filling the air. Nico's eyes locked onto Will's, and he pulled him close, their bodies swaying to the music.

As they danced, the kitchen transformed. The shadows receded, replaced by the warm glow of the kitchen light, which cast a golden aura around them. The clock's ticking faded into the background, replaced by the gentle rhythm of their breathing, their hearts beating in tandem.

Nico's hand slipped to the small of Will's back, his fingers tracing the curve of his spine. Will's eyes fluttered closed, his head dipping into the crook of Nico's neck. The world outside receded, leaving only the two of them, lost in the gentle ebb and flow of the music.

"Remember when we thought we'd never see the stars again?" Nico whispered, his breath warm against Will's ear.

Will's eyes snapped open, his gaze locking onto Nico's. "We're a long way from the underworld," he replied, his voice barely above a whisper.

Nico's smile was a work of art, a masterpiece of hope and resilience. "In this moment, we're exactly where we need to be."

As the music swelled, their bodies moved in perfect sync, their steps weaving a gentle waltz across the kitchen floor. The world outside might be dark and chaotic, but in this moment, they'd created their own sanctuary, a place where the horrors of Tartarus couldn't touch them.

The song faded, leaving only the soft hum of the refrigerator and the gentle creak of the old wooden floor. Will and Nico slowed, their bodies swaying to a stop, their eyes locked in a deep, wordless understanding.

In the silence, they found peace, their shared rituals a testament to the strength of their bond. As they stood there, wrapped in each other's arms, the weight of their past slowly lifted, lost in the gentle rhythm of the present.
